com.pega.pegarules.pub.runtime

Interface PegaURLBuilderOld


  • public interface PegaURLBuilderOld
    PegaURLBuilder is used to construct Pega URLs.

    Usage:
    1. Get an instance of URL Builder:
    Example: pega.getURLBuilder();

    2. Set components of the URL:
    a.withPublicLinkURL() : Use this method to generate the URL with already defined PublicLinkURL. If no PublicLinkURL is defined, then by default pxReqContextURI will be used.
    Examle: pega.getURLBuilder().withPublicLinkURL().build();

    b. withServlet(String ServletName)/withDefaultServlet() :
    Use this method to specify the servlet to be used, if these are not invoked there will be no servlet component in the generated URL.
    Example:
    pega.getURLBuilder().withServlet("PRAuth").build(); e.g. http://test.pega.com/prweb/PRAuth/
    pega.getURLBuilder().withDefaultServlet().build(); e.g. http://test.pega.com/prweb/PRServlet/
    pega.getURLBuilder().build(); e.g. http://test.pega.com/pweb/

    c.withUniqueSession() : This method can be invoked when multiple sessions for the same application in same browser are needed. A 4 digit random identifier is generated and appended to alias with _
    Example: pega.getURLBuilder().withUniqueSession().build();

    d. withQueryParams(String QueryParameters) :
    Use this method to supply query parameters to the generated URL. If not invoked the generated URL will not have any query parameters.
    Example: pega.getURLBuilder().withDefaultServlet().withQueryParams("pzuiactionzzz=CXtpbn").build(); e.g. http://test.pega.com/prweb/PRServlet/?pzuiactionzzz=CXpbn

    3.Build the URL:
    Invoke the build() method to generate the URL with the components supplied. It returns generated URL in String format.

    Example: String url = pega.getURLBuilder().withServlet("PRAuth").withQueryParams("pzuiactionzzz=CXtpbn").build(); e.g. http://test.pega.com/prweb/PRAuth/?pzuiactionzzz=CXpbn
